page.title: 19A DAY IN THE COUNTRY
page.content: The date is Sunday the 16th June 1985 and it is a warm Summer's day just right for a picnic! We find a spot on farmland near Golden Cross under a large broken branch with a wonderful view across the fields to Chiddingly church. Our lunch consists of ham sandwhices (49p a qtr lb); local meat pies (45p each); salad bought fresh from a local farm shop; fresh strawberries picked at a PYO (pick your own) centre down the road for only 40p a lb. This was washed down with a bottle of a local elderberry wine which cost only 1.99 While sleeping off the lunch under a hot midday sun, the silence was interrupted by the screech of an RAF figter aircraft as it flew overhead. Soon it was time to return to normality ane for work on Monday !
